title.narrative: Pathways to Economic Inclusion and Self-Reliance of the Refugees and Host Communities in Rwanda through Scaling up Graduation Approach

description.narrative: To enable targeted poor and vulnerable households of refugees and host communities in Rwanda to become self-reliant and graduate out of extreme poverty by 2024.

participating-org.narrative: United Nations Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees

sector.narrative: Refugees/asylum seekers in donor countries (non-sector allocable)

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

title.narrative: 6.1 Market survey /value chain analysis conducted or available (yes/no) 6.2 Socio economic profile and livelihood capacities of PoC defined and monitored /baseline established (yes/no)

target.value:
1.1 Market survey /value chain analysis conducted
1.2 Socio economic profile and livelihoods capacities of PoC defined and monitored /baseline established

2.1 Market linkage/value chain analysis reviewed (light touch, UNHCR Team with Value Chain Partners/UN partners subject to availability of their staff)
Participatory Assessment/Livelihoods Assessment Conducted (In-house/UNHCR MFT jointly with other partners subject to availability of Government and UN partner staff)

title.narrative: 3. Beneficiaries trained in financial literacy and savings groups/loans associations formation and management

3.1 # of beneficiaries trained in financial literacy for livelihoods purposes 3.2 # of beneficiaries trained in the formation, organization and opportunity identification of Savings groups and Loan Associations development

target.value: 1.3 By end of year 2022, 470 beneficiaries will receive basic financial literacy training 1.4 By end of year 2022, 470 beneficiaries will receive training in the formation, organization, and opportunity identification of Small Savings groups /Loan Associations development

1.5 By end of year 2023, 1,030 beneficiaries will receive basic financial literacy training 1.6 By end of year 2023,1030 beneficiaries will receive training in the formation, organization, and opportunity identification of Small Savings groups /Loan Associations development
No training activities on financial literacy will be conducted in 2024

title.narrative: 4.1 # of beneficiaries coached on graduation and self-reliance pathway

target.value: 1.7 By end of year 2022, 470 POCs beneficiaries will be coached on graduation and self-reliance pathway
1.8 By end of year 2023, 1,030 beneficiaries will be coached on graduation and self-reliance pathway
1.9 By end of year 2023, all 1,500 beneficiaries will receive final coaching services and follow-up on their self-reliance and graduation pathway.

title.narrative: 5. Beneficiaries received lump-sum livelihoods cash grants for business start-up or wage-employment
5.1 # of beneficiaries with viable business plans who receive cash grants / start-up kits to start-up/ improve their business or agricultural activity or wage-employment

target.value: 2.0 By end of year 2022, 470 beneficiaries have received start-up cash grants
2.1 By end of year 2023, 1,030 have received start-up cash grants
No Direct support of cash grants/production kits will be provided

title.narrative: 1. Monthly cash assistance for consumption provided to targeted highly vulnerable beneficiaries’ households
1.1 # of households’ beneficiaries who receive monthly cash for consumption support

target.value: By end of year 2022, 94 hhs have received cash for consumptions support
By end of year 2023, 206 hhs have received cash for consumption support
No direct consumption for support is given to hhs the 3rd year since they have started building their resilience

title.narrative: 2. Beneficiaries trained in business entrepreneurial skills and technical skills
2.1 # of beneficiaries trained in entrepreneurship and business skills 2.2 # of beneficiaries trained in technical training (agricultural / TVET training)

target.value: Inception Phase 1.1 By end of year 2022, cohort 1 of capacity development training is completed and delivered to 470 POCs
1.2 By end of year 2023, cohort 2 of capacity development training is completed and delivered to all 1,030 POCs
No skills trainings will be conducted in year 3. Only follow-up activities, market linkages, capacity building support, results documentation and evaluation etc.

title.narrative: Targeted refugees and host communities graduate out of extreme poverty

Indicator 1. % of the project beneficiaries (refugees and host communities) graduating out of extreme poverty based on a set of composite graduation criteria: (i) acceptable food consumption score (ii) more than 1 source of income (iii) economic capacity to cover the food basket expenditure without assistance (iv) use of financial services (savings/loans/transfers) (v) active member of a social group (cooperative/saving group/ other social groups)

target.value: 70% of the targeted 1,500 project beneficiaries (1,050 refugees and 450 hosts community) will be graduated out of extreme poverty
